xwikidoc.title: IRC Archive for channel #phenotips on 03 June 2014
xwikidoc.content: <sdumitriu1> has quit 06:07 <mcupak> has quit 09:04 <vijay13> has quit 09:30 <sdumitriu1> has joined #phenotips 13:26 <phenotips_org> has joined #phenotips 13:45 <BFlavien> has quit 13:54 <BFlavien> has joined #phenotips 14:13 <BFlavien> has quit 15:02 <vijay13> has quit 16:14 <phenotips_guest_> has joined #phenotips 17:10 <sdumitriu1> has quit 17:11 <sdumitriu1> has joined #phenotips 17:54 <akats> sdumitriu: You never answered my question about getConnectionToken 17:54 <sdumitriu> getConnectionToken should be robust 17:54 <sdumitriu> It should check if the patient has a document or not 17:55 <sdumitriu> If not, just return null 17:55 <sdumitriu> In general, exceptions are only supposed to be used for exceptional cases 17:55 <sdumitriu> Expecting exceptions for normal program flow is wrong 17:56 <sdumitriu> So yes, you can catch exceptions in the code to be sure the program always works, but any known exception should be solved so that there aren't any 18:05 <akats> has left #phenotips 18:05 <phenotips_guest_> has quit 22:18 <phenotips_org> has joined #phenotips
